An example of cogent is the idea that climate change is caused by the actions of humans. Appealing to the intellect or powers of reasoning; convincing: a cogent argument. See Synonyms at valid. Latin cōgēns, cōgent- , present participle of cōgere, to force: co- , co- + agere, to drive; see ag-in Indo-European roots.
